messages.title: Kirsty will be a strong voice for you and your family.
messages.content: Kirsty Blackman is an active local councillor representing Hilton, Stockethill & Woodside. Having been elected in 2007 and re-elected in 2012 she has built up a wealth of experience working for the people of Aberdeen. She is married with two children and understands the difficulties faced by hard working families. Kirsty is the Convenor of the SNP Group in Aberdeen City Council and has held posts as the council's spokesperson for Education, Culture and Sport, for building ten schools and was the convener of the authority's Licensing Committee. She knows how to get things done for Aberdeen and will work hard to make that happen at Scotland's voice at Westminster.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: With strong Scottish voices at Westminster we will hold the government of the day to account on more powers.
The real powers of home rule to create jobs and protect services.
The SNP will speak out against unfair policies like the Bedroom Tax and speak up for social justice for all.
And we'll fight tooth and nail against spending tens of billions on Trident when that money should be spent on public services and better childcare.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The General Election on May 7th is Scotland's opportunity to make our voice heard loudly and clearly.

issues.education: Kirsty is the council's spokesperson for Education, Culture and Sport.
issues.governance: With strong Scottish voices at Westminster we will hold the government of the day to account on more powers.

images.caption: Kirsty Blackman – A strong local voice for Aberdeen North.
